description: Information required about your experiments to trigger the creation of a metadata spreadsheet.
name: template-questionnaire

technologyType.user_friendly: Did you use imaging and/or sequencing to generate your data?
technologyType.guidelines: The technology type tells us whether we should add fields like ‘sequencing method’ for a sequencing experiment or ‘imaged sliced thickness’ for an imaging experiment.

libraryPreparation.user_friendly: What type of library preparation technique did you use?
libraryPreparation.guidelines: The library preparation method tells us whether we should add fields like ‘well id’ for plate-based sequencing or ‘cell barcode-containing read’ for droplet-based sequencing.

identifyingOrganisms.user_friendly: What species are the donors of your experiment?
identifyingOrganisms.guidelines: The species of your donors tells us whether we should add fields like ‘strain’ for mouse experiments and ‘ethnicity’ and ‘medical history’ for human experiments.

donorsRelated.user_friendly: Are any of your donors related to one another?
donorsRelated.guidelines: Answering yes to this question allows you to link related donors, for example a sample from a mother to that of its embryo.

preNatalQuantity.user_friendly: Are any of your samples from prenatal donors?
preNatalQuantity.guidelines: This information tells us whether we should include fields to record pre-birth age.

specimenType.user_friendly: What type of tissue did you use?
specimenType.guidelines: The type of specimen tells us whether we should add fields related to the biomaterial type, for example ‘organ’ for primary tissue or ‘organ model’ for a cell line model.

specimenPurchased.guidelines: If 'Yes', it will add fields for capturing purchase information.

experimentInfo.user_friendly: Do you wish to record information about the where, when and who of your experiment?
experimentInfo.guidelines: Answering yes to this question will add fields to record the location, name/initials of the performer, and the date and time when your experiment was performed.

protocols.user_friendly: Did you use any of the following additional protocols?
protocols.guidelines: The protocol types tell us whether to add a tab to record information specific to a certain protocol type, for example ‘markers’ for an enrichment protocol.

timecourse.user_friendly: Did your experiment involve a timecourse?
timecourse.guidelines: Answering yes will add timecourse-specific fields to the template.

timecourseBiomaterialType.guidelines: This will add timecourse related fields to the selected biomaterial/s.

preservedTissue.user_friendly: Did you preserve or store the tissue sample?
preservedTissue.guidelines: Answering yes will add fields related to the preservation and storage of the tissue such as the type and duration of storage.

tissueState.user_friendly: Do you wish to record information about the state of the tissue sample?
tissueState.guidelines: Answering yes will add fields related to the condition of the tissue at the time of collection such as ischemic temperature and descriptive text and images.

title: Generate your metadata spreadsheet
